snippet: New York’s top prosecutor charged that, as a result of the foundation’s failings, more than 1,100 horses in its control failed to receive basic care.
abstract: New York attorney general Eric T Schneiderman files lawsuit against Thoroughbred Retirement Foundation, one of the largest nonprofit organizations devoted to retired racehorses, claiming the foundation failed to provide funds for the basic care of the more than 1,100 horses in their control.
lead_paragraph: New York’s top prosecutor charged that, as a result of the foundation’s failings, more than 1,100 horses in its control failed to receive basic care.

headline.seo: New York Attorney General Sues Foundation for Retired Racehorses
headline.main: State Attorney General Sues Foundation for Retired Racehorses
headline.print_headline: Racehorses Neglected By Charity, Suit Says
